notes:
## Power ⚡
Take [Hidden Blade](item_a820416d-85e5-4018-b20a-dc1cbf744900) to make Genji's quick melee into a serious threat and lay the groundwork for the build to evolve in the next rounds.

## Items ⚔️
Take the three items that enhance quick melee.

## Playstyle
Classic genji playstyle, but try to use quick melee more often in between attacks to heal yourself and deal extra damage. Using quick melee multiple times in a row in a 1v1 can be a viable strategy sometimes as well, especially if you are both low and you can finish them off with a couple melees while keeping yourself alive with the heals. Melee lifesteal also lets you be a little more aggressive with your ult.

## Loadout Damage Numbers
* 🤜 Quick melee will deal 💢68 damage and heal for 💚59.
* 🗡 Dragonblade attacks will deal 💢116 damage and heal for 💚58.

## Alternative Build: Burst Damage
[Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) could be a consideration instead of [Hidden Blade](item_a820416d-85e5-4018-b20a-dc1cbf744900) as the first power to try to go for a burst damage build (with [Power Playbook](item_6d8803cf-baa7-46ee-af91-51e7f2301418) instead of [Weapon Grease](item_961ae72f-434f-406b-a89b-ab8efec806bf)), but the self healing 59 every quick melee plus the lifesteal added to Dragonblade gets more consistent value in my opinion

___
## Dragonblade Notes
Bade attacks are considered melee, but not quick melee. This means, for example, that they trigger [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7), but not [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7). They work with [Hidden Blade](item_a820416d-85e5-4018-b20a-dc1cbf744900)’s melee lifesteal, but not the quick melee damage increase. [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) melee damage bonus applies, but they cannot crit.

[Dragon's Breath](item_32dc8374-7541-46fb-9891-29b7fbe9ed4d) projectiles deal half of the total damage that Dragonblade melee attacks deal. Yes, that means these projectiles are boosted by melee damage bonuses. These projectiles however, count as ranged attacks so they can only lifesteal from weapon lifesteal.

## Attack Speed
Attack speed works with shuriken attacks, quick melee, and Dragonblade.

## Item Notes
* [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce) 10% bonus critical damage does not affect quick melee crits, but the vision after crits does apply to quick melee crits.
* [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b) works with quick melee and blade.
* [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) armor piercing works with everything on all heroes as far as I have seen.
* [El-sa'ka Supressor](item_b4298dd9-9b93-461f-a2e0-843402667100) healing reduction does not apply to melee crits.
* [Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61) can restore ammo from damage dealt to barriers from [Dragon's Breath](item_32dc8374-7541-46fb-9891-29b7fbe9ed4d) projectiles, but this is useless.
* [Weapon Jammer](item_72386db6-753e-413d-aa2a-f1389842f47f) seems to steal attack speed when attacking with Dragonblade, but not quick melee. However, I found this difficult to test and I could be wrong.

# Conclusions
Weapon power is extremely valuable since it works with shurikens, blade, and quick melee. Even if building for blade damage, it is not worth it to build ability power even though you can get more ability power and therefore more blade damage per credit spent. The only reason to build ability power is in dash focused builds, but since dash is on an eight cooldown with only 50 base damage, going for a dash focused build does not seem like a good idea. Especially since if you put all your credits into ability power, it is very hard to finish off kills with shurikens and quick melee to reset your dash cooldown.

Since melee damage bonus and weapon power scale multiplicatively for quick melee damage, each point of melee damage bonus makes weapon power more effective and vice versa. This makes melee damage bonus a valuable asset rather than being strictly worse than weapon power.

# P.S.
Big shoutout to Edamame’s “Better Stadium Practice Range!” code P05GM which made testing damage numbers a lot easier.

*While you were partying, I studied the blade.*

## Items ⚔️
[Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) and [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) are both viable options for round 2. [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) has more offensive potential whereas [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) is the more defensive build. If you are confident you can get value from the quick melee crit, go with the aggressive build. I think it has a higher ceiling so I am choosing it as the default build. Let's compare the numbers below assuming you also have exactly enough credits for [Siphon Gloves](item_099f8177-c2a4-4e13-b321-99349f8b1eb7) and [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0).

| | Quick Melee Damage | Quick Melee Lifesteal + Heal |
| -------- | -------- | -------- |
| [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) | 78.8 | 64.4 |
| [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) crit | 118.1 | 84.1 |
| [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) | 74.6 | 79.8 |

As you can see, [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) gives the potential to do significantly more damage while not lacking in the lifesteal department, whereas [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) gives more healing when attacking from the front and additionally provides armor and movespeed.

### Poverty Plan 😭💸

If you can’t afford to buy common items on top of the epic item you chose, that’s fine. If you can’t even afford one epic, get [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) and keep as many common items from round 1 as you can.

## Playstyle
With [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) you need to get value from the backstab crit. A typical hard commitment would be dashing through a target and using quick melee on their back before they can turn around, then alternate shuriken and melee to finish them off. Other ways to get value from the melee crit is sneaking behind people or meleeing targets who are running away from you.

## Loadout Damage Numbers
* 🤜 Quick melee will deal 💢79 damage and heal for 💚64.
* 🤜❗️ Quick melee crit will deal 💢118 damage and heal for 💚84.
* 🗡 Dragonblade attacks will deal 💢143 damage and heal for 💚72.

## Power ⚡
[Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) adds a huge burst of damage and healing to your kit. It synergizes perfectly with [Hidden Blade](item_a820416d-85e5-4018-b20a-dc1cbf744900)’s lifesteal and the melee boosting items you already want to buy.

## Items ⚔️
Ideally, purchase the epic item you didn’t choose last round. If you can’t afford that, [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) plus a bunch of common items will do.

### Bait 🎣

I have seen a few guides saying that [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) is a great item for melee Genji, but I am not sure why. The armor reduction literally just increases melee damage by 3.5. If you were planning on pumping shurikens into their tank, it would be a decent item, giving 3.5 more damage shuriken, but that is not the plan with this build. For quick melee attacks, once you have [Hidden Blade](item_a820416d-85e5-4018-b20a-dc1cbf744900) and [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca), you actually get more melee damage from acquiring 20% weapon power than you do from [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) while attacking enemies with armor. Therefore, I think [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) plus [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) for 7000 credits is generally better than [Codebreaker](item_caa96c7e-655f-4d03-9bd9-0f41937fec27) for 9000 credits.

## Playstyle
You still want to be getting behind your targets either with Swift Strike or sneaking behind people. Now you have an additional tool for finishing off targets. With the exact recommended loadout, your dragon blade is doing 159.5 damage, so you can basically finish off any squishy target that you gen below half health with [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168). Be warned that if you just double tap your Deflect hotkey it will not immediately cancel since it has a 0.27 second minimum duration. To strike as quickly as possible, spam your deflect hotkey or learn the timing. When using Deflect defensively, try to also slash an easy target if possible, as it lifesteals a lot and it triggers [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7)’s buff.

## Loadout Damage Numbers
* 🤜 Quick melee will deal 💢85 damage and heal for 💚60.
* 🤜❗️ Quick melee crit will deal 💢128 damage and heal for 💚81.
* 🗡 Dragonblade attacks will deal 💢159 damage and heal for 💚96.
*Including [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) healing*

## Items ⚔️
[Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) provides much needed weapon power which multiplies the effectiveness of your melee damage bonus you already have built up. After this, the build is flexible. By default I recommend [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054), which is a great offensive item giving valuable attack speed and movement speed, synergizing well with the melee strategy. For defensive options, [Anti-Beam Coating](item_1ab73e1c-aaa1-4026-89cd-68404db7fd93) is necessary in some games and [Vital-E-Tee](item_b92e6f1d-3aac-4eec-b027-00c8e1529016) is a good generic option.

### Poverty Plan 😭💸
First priority is buying [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca) and [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7). If you are getting destroyed by both Zarya and Moira, prioritize [Anti-Beam Coating](item_1ab73e1c-aaa1-4026-89cd-68404db7fd93), but otherwise buy as much weapon power as you can. You can simply replace [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054) with [Weapon Grease](item_961ae72f-434f-406b-a89b-ab8efec806bf) and not lose out on very much.

## Playstyle

Nothing really changes this round, you just have more damage and/or survivability.

## Loadout damage numbers
* 🤜 Quick melee will deal 💢97 damage and heal for 💚67.
* 🤜❗️ Quick melee crit will deal 💢146 damage and heal for 💚91.
* 🗡 Dragonblade attacks will deal 💢176 damage and heal for 💚106.
*Including [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) healing*

Example combo:
* Dash through them dealing 50 damage
* Perform a quick melee crit dealing 145.8 damage
* Secondary fire for three shuriken body shots dealing 97.2 damage
* [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) for 176 damage
* Total: 469 damage!!
This is enough to kill most DPS or supports as long as they aren’t getting significant healing, plus you lifesteal a lot and can reset your dash to get out so you should be pretty safe.

round_upgrades.notes: Sometimes, you just need it. You can keep it for future rounds if needed.
Very good value for your credits for burst damage. Gives 15% blade damage.

notes:
## Power ⚡
[Hanamura Healing](item_d210417d-1e30-4571-a4f3-cccd1dfc23ca) is the obvious next choice for this build. The healing it provides pushes Genji’s survivability over the top and makes you significantly tankier. Remember, the overhealth from critical hits works with melee crits!

## Items ⚔️
[Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b) is an amazing item with this build since it gives the most raw weapon power, which we know is the most valuable stat. You could consider [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce), but remember the 10% bonus does not work with quick melee crits and the [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b) 10% bonus weapon power against low health enemies works with quick melee and Dragonblade. If you are a Genji master who will hit all your shuriken headshots, you can go with [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce), but for the rest of us, I recommend [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b).

## Playstyle
Adding [Hanamura Healing](item_d210417d-1e30-4571-a4f3-cccd1dfc23ca) to your kit doesn’t really change the playstyle, it just gives you more survivability so that you can keep being aggressive as the opponents are also scaling up and becoming more of a threat.

## Loadout damage numbers
* 🤜 Quick melee will deal 💢117 damage and heal for 💚78.
* 🤜❗️ Quick melee crit will deal 💢176 damage and heal for 💚107.
* 🗡 Dragonblade attacks will deal 💢204 damage and heal for 💚121.
*Including [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) healing*

## Alternative Build: 🥷 Aura Farming Dragonblade Ninja
If you have enough aura, you will already know that [Hanamura Healing](item_d210417d-1e30-4571-a4f3-cccd1dfc23ca) is kinda lame. Why would you need to heal yourself more if you can just kill all the opponents? [Dragon's Breath](item_32dc8374-7541-46fb-9891-29b7fbe9ed4d), on the other hand, brings your damage to the next level adding range to [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) and turning your ultimate into a quintuple kill machine. The problem with this build is that investing too much in your ultimate means you aren’t as much of a consistent threat throughout the round. You can mitigate this problem by purchasing [Transference Delta](item_4bcdd047-90a2-43af-8d57-160cb21022ee) and [Enduring Edge](item_6a68babb-9434-42a0-8374-5b5973e8b6db) to significantly increase the uptime of Dragonblade. However, you would have to sacrifice a lot to buy them this round, so I would advise waiting until the next round to do that.

### Warning
The [Dragon's Breath](item_32dc8374-7541-46fb-9891-29b7fbe9ed4d)’s build can be very dangerous against Orisa with [Spynstem Update](item_9fbbe756-5dd6-44f6-abd8-a8355f0be2b5) or even an opposing Genji. A volley of your slow moving projectiles can easily be deflected back to you and your team, killing multiple team members. Don’t ask how I know.

Not worth going for this build into certain lineups. D.Va can also eat the projectiles, but that’s not as big of a problem.

### Alternate Build Playstyle
Even though your blade now has a long range projectile component to it, you still want to be using the melee attack when possible since you have melee lifesteal and the melee attacks do more damage. The main benefit of this build is that you can use the projectiles to get eliminations to reset your dash cooldown to close the gap on someone and continue using the melee attacks. This is especially good against teams with lots of slippery targets that can evade you during your ult.

Even when meleeing, you still launch a projectile, so try to line up your targets to hit multiple opponents at once. Keep in mind, while playing in third person, if you attack a target that is very close to you, your aim will be adjusted to account for the difference in position between your crosshair and your hero’s face (where the attacks originate). Unfortunately this makes the piercing projectile go in an unintended direction when attacking a close up enemy with Dragonblade. You can easily replicate this in the practice range if you are unsure what I mean. I prefer playing Genji in third person, but first person might be worth it if you trying to get the absolute maximum potential from [Dragon's Breath](item_32dc8374-7541-46fb-9891-29b7fbe9ed4d).

## Items ⚔️
[Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643) is such a good all around item that you have probably used in countless different builds. It allows you to get even more value from the lifesteal you already have by converting it to overhealth. It gives a nice boost to lifesteal while also giving you some more juicy weapon power. What’s not to like?

## Loadout Damage Numbers
* 🤜 Quick melee will deal 💢126 damage and heal for 💚83.
* 🤜❗️ Quick melee crit will deal 💢188 damage and heal for 💚114 plus ❇️47 overhealth.
* 🗡 Dragonblade attacks will deal 💢226 damage and heal for 💚167.
*Including [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) healing*

## Alternative Build
If you are doing the [Dragon's Breath](item_32dc8374-7541-46fb-9891-29b7fbe9ed4d) build, you might want to pick up [Transference Delta](item_4bcdd047-90a2-43af-8d57-160cb21022ee) and [Enduring Edge](item_6a68babb-9434-42a0-8374-5b5973e8b6db) at this point. You can sell [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) and skip out on [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643). Yes, you will have less self healing, but you will be able to farm clips for your highlight reel and you can just blame your supports if you die.

## Power ⚡
If you haven’t won the game yet, now is your chance to have your fun with [Dragon's Breath](item_32dc8374-7541-46fb-9891-29b7fbe9ed4d). The previous alternate build and the mainline build converge at this point. If you already took [Dragon's Breath](item_32dc8374-7541-46fb-9891-29b7fbe9ed4d), I suggest going back for [Hanamura Healing](item_d210417d-1e30-4571-a4f3-cccd1dfc23ca) now.

## Items ⚔️
Pick up [Transference Delta](item_4bcdd047-90a2-43af-8d57-160cb21022ee) and [Enduring Edge](item_6a68babb-9434-42a0-8374-5b5973e8b6db). This combo makes your ults come more often and extends their duration significantly (up to 10 seconds from 6 seconds). Buy [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) because it is the best attack speed item and the movement speed helps you stick to targets after dashing. You can sell [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7) because the heal kinda falls off at this point and the rest of the items are too important.

### Poverty Plan 😭💸
Yes, this build is a little expensive. You can skip [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) for [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054), [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a), or even [Anti-Beam Coating](item_1ab73e1c-aaa1-4026-89cd-68404db7fd93) if it is a good game for it.

## Playstyle
You can still assassinate people with your main combo and backstab melee crits are still powerful, but you can see that the loadout damage numbers are slightly reduced. Your damage per second is about the same since you have more attack speed. Your main goal now is to farm ults and use them at important moments since Dragonblade is super powerful at this point. Depending on the game, Dragonblade can basically solo a team fight, so try not to stack your ult with your teammates’ ultimates if you don’t need to.

## Loadout Damage Numbers
The healing numbers are down, but they are now fully instant instead of including [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7).
* 🤜 Quick melee will deal 💢108 damage and heal for 💚54.
* 🤜❗️ Quick melee crit will deal 💢163 damage and heal for 💚82 plus ❇️41 overhealth.
* 🗡 Dragonblade attacks will deal 💢198 damage and heal for 💚128.

## Alternative Build: Mr. Consistent
If the enemies can reflect projectiles or you do not want to be overly reliant on your ult, go for the alternate build with [Hashimoto’s Bane](item_03650ff3-917e-45fe-aeed-11c0f24c0eba) instead. This build maximizes dps, sustain, and burst, but sacrifices on the flashy plays you can make.

For this build, you will want your inventory to be the following:
* [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48)
* [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b)
* [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce)
* [Ambusher Optics](item_742c3c71-17cd-4fa7-bf18-ddeae7d521ca)
* [Phantasmic Flux](item_5e644a79-cf6e-4196-8d0a-232f75004643)
* [Gloomgauntlet](item_76cb8fe3-3c1f-4769-a1ec-a9c2dc510ba7)

If you can’t afford this, swap [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce) for [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a).

Example combo:
* Dash through them dealing 55 damage
* Perform a quick melee crit dealing 188.325 damage
* Secondary fire for five shuriken body shots dealing 209.25 damage
* [Iaido Strike](item_0b4def91-53c9-4bb7-b706-05aff6e4b168) for 225.5 damage
* Total: 678.075 damage!!

round_upgrades.notes: Highest raw Dragonblade damage item. I don't really think it's that good though.
